title: Teaching course: Hemp, toxic metals, and agricultural vaccines
cleaned_text: On Saturday 25 March 2023, the programme will include several study modules: from the morphology and botany of the plant to its phyto-depurative properties in the soil; galenic cannabis, endocannabinoids and phytocannabinoids; experiences and research on the benefits of cannabinoid light oils in complete phyto-complex, heavy metal toxicity and harmful substances. On Sunday 26th the training modules will focus on the raw extraction of natural hemp in complete phyto-complex, dermo-cosmetics and functional ointments; ecological textile hemp, cultivation without chemicals; sharing on basic and study topics, and phytotherapeutic proposals. For their research, the organisers are inspired by the studies of the physician and hygienist Aldo Sacchetti, who 'had foreseen the drift of science and its subservience to techno-industry, its limitations and theoretical and practical errors'.
